nodes.text: [i][indent]'Canada has 'hate' speech/crimes laws and regulations and Canadian Christians, along with other people of faith, are being vehemently persecuted for speaking out publicly against the acceptance and promotion of homosexuality within their own country. I was told by Rev. Tristan NOT to bring most of our resources on homosexuality, for going through the Canadian border, they might get seized and I could possibly be denied entry into Canada. I was able to bring several hundred of SBM's tracts for the attendees, 'I Was Gay' and 'The Traditional American Family.'

They need to keep their opinions to themselves and out of the law the effect gay peoples lives. I see nothing wrong with locking up those who incite hatred towards gay people just as we lock up people who shout fire in a crowded theatre.
Default Conflict

Amazing. emoticon_rolleyes  jyoshu post garbage like this at the same time he whines about being called 'anti-gay'. emoticon_frazzled Go figure. jyoshu, what part of 'lies', 'hate-mongering', 'not accpted by the medical professoin' is it that you don't understand??????????? emoticon_wow Are you REALLY THAT DENSE?????????? You just shot what miniscule credibility you may have THOUGHT you had.You are no better than Stephen Bennett is; you spread his viciousness. You are both very sick people in need of help.

I've read your hate mail personally, and still have a copy--worse than anything Bennett has said and it would get you banned if I ever turned it in (though I won't because I'm not that kind of person). You have no ground anymore to say anything about anyone saying anything hateful, or commenting on the credibility of others. It's interesting that when some of you decide to attack the messenger, you assume it will automatically discount the message. No one ever said every single thing a speaker says has to be agreed with; it's part of dealing with issues to agree with some things and not others. Certainly I don't agree with everything Bennett said, but some of it needs to be repeated. Based on what I've seen and continue to see in the gay 'rights' movement, he's more on target about quite a few things than most of you would ever admit.
Default Conflict
some of it needs to be repeated.
And just specifically what parts are those? Mr. Bennett seems to think he is above the law, Canadian or otherwise. I quote from Page 3 of my US Passport:
Default Inference

By far most speech about homosexuality from those who don't approve is not hate speech. You've been listening to too much propaganda from gay lobby groups who think demonizing and working toward persecuting Christians for their beliefs is the best means to an end. If Canada limited it's persecution only to those who are trying to change the law, there wouldn't be a problem.
Default Conflict

You misunderstand me I believe they should all be locked up. Anyone who preaches against gay people freely living their lives as equal citizens with all the rights and responsibilites should be locked up in the darkest dungeon. There can be no compromise on this issue peoples lives are at stake.
Default Conflict
I didn't misunderstand you at all. Like I said, you are for persecuting religious people if they don't agree 100% with you.
No, persecution of anyone preaching hate against anyone.
Default Conflict

Is it only religious people who insite violence and hatred toward gays? NO! You're attempting, weakly at that, to jump on the Frist-train by saying hes persecuting religious people. As if religious people are being singled out.
Default Conflict
I wish they HAD arrested him!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Oh I've got no doubt that you do, and that you wish much worse on him than that as well.
Default Conflict
And just specifically what parts are those? Mr. Bennett seems to think he is above the law, Canadian or otherwise. I quote from Page 3 of my US Passport
It's still not right for religious people to have to never speak their beliefs. It's a form of tyranny.
Default Conflict
